sen.j: 敦明親王（あつあきらしんのう、正暦5年5月9日 (旧暦)（994年6月20日） - 永承6年1月8日 (旧暦)（1051年2月21日））は、第67代三条天皇の第一皇子、母は藤原済時の女・皇后藤原せい子。
sen.e: Imperial Prince Atsuakira (June 20, 994-February 21, 1051) was the first prince of the sixty seventh Emperor Sanjo, and his mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Seishi, a daughter of FUJIWARA no Naritoki.

Imperial Prince Atsuakira (June 20, 994-February 21, 1051) was the first prince of the sixty seventh Emperor Sanjo, and his mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Seishi, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Naritoki.

Imperial Prince Atsuakira (June 25, 994 - February 27, 1051) was the first prince of the sixty seventh Emperor Sanjo, and his mother was Empress FUJIWARA no Seishi, the daughter of FUJIWARA no Naritoki.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 父の三条天皇は藤原道長の圧力により、道長の孫にあたる一条天皇の第2皇子敦成親王（後一条天皇）を皇太子とした。
sen.e: His father, Emperor Sanjo was forced by FUJIWARA no Michinaga to install Imperial Prince Atsuhira (Emperor Goichijo), the second prince of Emperor Ichijo who was the grandchild of Michinaga as an imperial prince.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: His father, Emperor Sanjo was forced by FUJIWARA no Michinaga to install Imperial Prince Atsuhira (Emperor Goichijo), the second prince of Emperor Ichijo who was the grandchild of Michinaga as an imperial prince.

His father, Emperor Sanjo was forced by FUJIWARA no Michinaga to install Imperial Prince Atsuhira (Emperor Goichijo), the second prince of Emperor Ichijo who was the grandchild of Michinaga as a crown prince.
sen.cmt: 皇太子→crown prince としました。

sen.j: 長和5年1月29日に敦明親王は後一条天皇の皇太子となった。
sen.e: On January 29 in 1016, Imperial Prince Atsuakira became the imperial prince of Emperor Goichijo.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On January 29 in 1016, Imperial Prince Atsuakira became the imperial prince of Emperor Goichijo.
On March 16, 1016, Imperial Prince Atsuakira became the crown prince of Emperor Goichijo.
sen.cmt: 皇太子→crown prince としました。

sen.j: しかし、三条天皇が崩御すると、道長はまたもや敦明親王に圧力をかけていた。
sen.e: However, after Emperor Sanjo passed away, Michinaga put another pressure against Imperial Prince Atsuakira.
However, after Emperor Sanjo passed away, Michinaga put more pressure on Imperial Prince Atsuakira.
However, after Emperor Sanjo passed away, Michinaga put more pressure on Imperial Prince Atsuakira.

sen.j: 一方の親王側も14歳も年下の天皇の皇太子では次期天皇としての即位の可能性は低いと考え、自ら皇太子廃位を願い出た。
sen.e: Meanwhile, the Imperial Prince Atsuakira's side also offered to dethrone Atsuakira; they think that Atsuakira were not likely to be enthroned as he was fourteen years older than Atsuhira.
Meanwhile, Imperial Prince Atsuakira's side also offered to dethrone Atsuakira; they think that Atsuakira was not likely to be enthroned as he was fourteen years older than Atsuhira.
Meanwhile, Imperial Prince Atsuakira's side also offered to dethrone Atsuakira; they think that Atsuakira was not likely to be enthroned as he was 14 years older than Atsuhira.

sen.j: これにより、寛仁元年8月9日に皇太子を辞退した。
sen.e: On August 9 in 1017, Atsuakira declined to stay as a prince.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On August 9 in 1017, Atsuakira declined to stay as a prince.
On September 7, 1017, Atsuakira declined to stay as a crown prince.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 同25日に道長の計らいで小一条院太上天皇の尊号が贈られ、いわゆる准太上天皇としての処遇を得る一方で、道長の娘藤原寛子（母・源明子）を妃に迎える。
sen.e: On 25th, Michinaga arranged to grant the honorary title of Ko-Ichijo-in Daijo tenno (the Retired Emperor) to Atsuakira, which meant he was treated as so-called Jun Daijo tenno (quasi ex-emperor), and he took FUJIWARA no Kanshi (her mother was MINAMOTO no Akiko), the daughter of Michinaga as a wife.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: On 25th, Michinaga arranged to grant the honorary title of Ko-Ichijo-in Daijo tenno (the Retired Emperor) to Atsuakira, which meant he was treated as so-called Jun Daijo tenno (quasi ex-emperor), and he took FUJIWARA no Kanshi (her mother was MINAMOTO no Akiko), the daughter of Michinaga as his wife.

On September 23 of the same year, Michinaga arranged to grant the honorary title of Ko-Ichijo-in Daijo tenno (the Retired Emperor) to Atsuakira, which meant he was treated as so-called Jun Daijo tenno (quasi Retired Emperor), and he took FUJIWARA no Kanshi (her mother was MINAMOTO no Akiko), the daughter of Michinaga as his wife.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: 更に家司として受領・随身を受けた。
sen.e: Furthermore, he assumed Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) and zuijin (a guard) as a Keishi (household superintendent).
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Furthermore, he assumed Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) and zuijin (a guard) as a Keishi (household superintendent).
Furthermore, he assumed Zuryo (the head of the provincial governors) and zuijin (a guard) as a Keishi (household superintendent).

sen.j: 親王所生の子供達が三条天皇の猶子の資格として二世王でありながら親王宣下を受けるなど破格の待遇を受けた。
sen.e: His children born in the imperial prince's place was treated in a too honorable way; they were proclaimed as an imperial prince eligible for the adopted child of Emperor Sanjo though they were the children of the ex-emperor.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: His children born in the imperial prince's palace was treated in an excessively honorable way; they were proclaimed as imperial princes eligible to become the adopted children of Emperor Sanjo though they were actually the children of the ex-emperor.

His children born in the imperial prince's palace were treated in an excessively honorable way; they were proclaimed as imperial princes eligible to become the adopted children of Emperor Sanjo although they were actually the children of the retired emperor.

sen.j: しかし、これによって親王に捨てられる形となった正室藤原延子は悲しみの余りに急死した。
sen.e: However, for the circumstances above, FUJIWARA no Enshi, the lawful wife of Imperial Prince Atsuakira, was abandoned by Imperial prince Atsuakira, and she died suddenly in her sorrow.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: However, for the circumstances above, FUJIWARA no Enshi, the lawful wife of Imperial Prince Atsuakira, was abandoned by Imperial prince Atsuakira, and she died suddenly in her sorrow.
However, for the circumstances above, FUJIWARA no Enshi, the lawful wife of Imperial Prince Atsuakira, was abandoned by Imperial Prince Atsuakira, and she died suddenly in her sorrow.

sen.j: 続いてその父親の左大臣藤原顕光（関白藤原兼通の長男）も失意のうちに病死した。
sen.e: Subsequently, FUJIWARA no Akimitsu, Sadaijin (minister of the left), her father (the eldest son of the Chancellor; chief adviser to the emperor, FUJIWARA no Kanemichi) died by disease in despair and hopelessness.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Subsequently, FUJIWARA no Akimitsu, Sadaijin (minister of the left), her father (the eldest son of the Chancellor; chief adviser to the emperor, FUJIWARA no Kanemichi) died from disease in despair and hopelessness.

Subsequently, FUJIWARA no Akimitsu, Sadaijin (Minister of the Left), her father (the eldest son of Kanpaku (chief adviser to the emperor), FUJIWARA no Kanemichi) died from disease in despair and hopelessness.

sen.j: 顕光父娘はその後怨霊になって道長一族に祟ったとされた。
sen.e: It was said that Akimitsu and Enshi who turned out to be a ghost haunted Michinaga's whole family.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It was said that Akimitsu and Enshi who turned out to be a ghost, haunted Michinaga's whole family.
It was said that Akimitsu and Enshi who turned out to be a ghost, haunted Michinaga's whole family.

sen.j: 人々は顕光を「悪霊左府（左大臣）」と呼んで恐れたと伝えられている。
sen.e: People seemed to be afraid of Akimitsu calling him `demoniac Sadaijin.'
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: People seemed to be afraid of Akimitsu calling him `demoniac Sadaijin.'
People seemed to be afraid of Akimitsu calling him 'demoniac Sadaijin.'
sen.cmt: アポストロフィーを修正しました。

sen.j: その一方で、親王に関しては短慮な振舞いが多く、藤原実資の『小右記』には親王に対する批判が立太子以前より多く記されている。
sen.e: Meanwhile, Criticism against Imperial Prince Atsuakira had been often indicated in "Shoyuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) since before Atsuakira was installed as a prince; he behaved indiscreetly.

Meanwhile, Criticism against Imperial Prince Atsuakira had been often indicated in "Shoyuki" (the diary of FUJIWARA no Sanesuke) because before Atsuakira was installed as a prince; he behaved indiscreetly.

sen.cmt: セミコロン→カンマに変更しました。

sen.j: 例えば長和3年（1014年）6月16日には加賀国源政職に、12月8日には弁官藤原定頼に暴行を振るったことが記されている。
sen.e: For instance, it was stated that he committed violence against MINAMOTO no Masamoto in Kaga Province on June 16 in 1014 and against FUJIWARA no Sadayori, Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) on December 8.

For instance, it was stated that he committed violence against MINAMOTO no Masamoto in Kaga Province on July 21, 1014 and against FUJIWARA no Sadayori, Benkan (Oversight Department: division of the daijokan responsible for controlling central and provincial governmental offices) on January 7, 1015.
sen.cmt: グレゴリオ暦に修正しました。

sen.j: また、藤原行成の『権記』にも皇太子辞退の報を受けて、顔相に詳しくないと前置きしながら「無龍顔」（天皇の相ではなかった）と述べている（寛仁元年8月8日条）。
sen.e: It is also stated in "Gonki" (FUJIWARA no Yukinari's diary) that Atsuakira's face was not the face deserved for an emperor saying that he was not familiar with physiognomy when he heard about Atsuakira's refusal for staying as a crown prince.

It is also stated in "Gonki" (FUJIWARA no Yukinari's diary) that Atsuakira's face was not a face deserved for an emperor saying that he was not familiar with physiognomy when he heard about Atsuakira's refusal to remain crown prince.
